title: Id like to run a
categories: Discussion

imagelink: []
thumblinks: []
---

I&#39;d like to run a collaborative worldbuilding session next week, to build out the city my players are now suddenly in. Are there any tools out there that do city-building specifically? If not, I&#39;ll hack together some Microscope and some Perilous Wilds and have a good time still, but seemed worth asking!
<div id='comment z13jw3bion2lfvbe5221vn25rqjczlllv'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/100812462809734403456_photo.jpg'> Alfred Rudzki Hitchcock</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-31 03:25:40 (edited: 2017-05-31 03:25:40)</cite></p>
        <p>Vast &amp; Starlit&#39;s planet-creation is just as good for making up a city I would imagine, and the free version of Godbound is loaded with tables that could probably be rolled on for town-making goodness. There&#39;s a town builder PDF I found the other day whose name I forget; I&#39;ll try to find it and post it.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13jw3bion2lfvbe5221vn25rqjczlllv'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/106352477543856604925_photo.jpg'> Shel Kahn</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-31 03:30:33 (edited: 2017-05-31 03:30:33)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/100812462809734403456" oid="100812462809734403456">Alfred Rudzki</a></span> Thanks very much! I thik a town builder seems more my scale than the planet creation process, though it does look like a fun time!</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13jw3bion2lfvbe5221vn25rqjczlllv'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101824580455031797035_photo.jpg'> Brian Holland</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-31 03:37:07 (edited: 2017-05-31 03:37:07)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/106352477543856604925" oid="106352477543856604925">Rachel Kahn</a></span>, here&#39;s a drop die chart that <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/112928858730524882505" oid="112928858730524882505">Eric Nieudan</a></span> posted. I haven&#39;t used it yet but it looks like a great tool to build a city.<br /><br /><a href="https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0BxHKe4JbIMLQSUtwaHFmS0l4dE0?usp=sharing" data-embed="CNECCNACCM8CCAAST2h0dHBzOi8vZHJpdmUuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbS9kcml2ZS9mb2xkZXJzLzBCeEhLZTRKYklNTFFTVXR3YUhGbVMwbDRkRTA__dXNwPXNoYXJpbmc" data-attachment-render-hint="1" class="ot-anchor">https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0BxHKe4JbIMLQSUtwaHFmS0l4dE0?usp=sharing</a></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13jw3bion2lfvbe5221vn25rqjczlllv'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/114673671586686174539_photo.jpg'> Jason Pitre</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-31 03:38:24 (edited: 2017-05-31 03:41:07)</cite></p>
        <p>I would recommend you check out the Dresden Files RPG city creation system or the Noirlandia RPG for some relevant tools on that front. They are both pretty robust and fun toolkits. <br /><br />You might want to take a look at my free little product, &quot;A Spark in Fate Core&quot; for another approach if you are curious, though it&#39;s less purpose-built for cities.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13jw3bion2lfvbe5221vn25rqjczlllv'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101025241405784788544_photo.jpg'> Michael Prescott</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-31 11:26:13 (edited: 2017-05-31 11:26:13)</cite></p>
        <p>Would how &quot;to host a dungeon&quot; be adaptable to a city? (Still think Microscope is very good choice.)</p>
</div>

<div id='comment z13jw3bion2lfvbe5221vn25rqjczlllv'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/106352477543856604925_photo.jpg'> Shel Kahn</h4>

        <p>Thanks so much again everyone for your suggestions! I ended up going with mostly reskinning Perilous Wilds for the first collaborative session and we&#39;re wrapping it up this Tuesday, where I&#39;ll probably bust out a few more of these excellent tables!</p>
</div>
